resources.string:
Firmware Installation Required

To use this app, you need an Android Smartphone with a Broadcom BCM4339 Wi-Fi chip running firmware version 6.37.34.43. This is for example the case, when using a Nexus 5 with stock firmware version M4B30Z.

If and only if the above requirement evaluates to true, you may continue to install the jamming firmware. Keep in mind that this firmware might damage your hardware and will void your hardware's warranty. You use the firmware as well as this app at your own risk and responsibility. By using our firmware and this app, you agree that you will not hold any of the Nexmon developers responsible for any harm that results from using any of our tools.

In the following you may create a backup of the original firmware that copies the firmware file from /vendor/firmware/fw_bcmdhd.bin to /sdcard/fw_bcmdhd.orig.bin. Once copied, you may continue to install the jamming firmware. To revert to the original firmware, you have to manually remount your system partition writable and then copy the backup to its original location.
